meanings.definition: A person who gives a guarantee.
meanings.sent1: The guarantors of the loan promised to pay if the borrower couldn't.
meanings.sent2: The real estate deal required two guarantors to secure the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The guarantors at the bank were like financial superheroes, swooping in to save the day.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, guarantors are the safety nets that catch you when you fall.
meanings.sent5: The role of guarantors is crucial in ensuring the success of many business transactions.

meanings.definition: A person who makes a guarantee.
meanings.sent1: The guarantors of the warranty assured customers of quality service.
meanings.sent2: As guarantors of the contract, they were responsible for upholding its terms.
meanings.sent3: The guarantors of the party's success were the energetic event planners.
meanings.sent4: She stood as a guarantor, her words a shield against doubt and uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The guarantors of the project were determined to see it through to completion.
